epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
epd_metadata.pcr_review_conducted_by: The Technical Committee of the International EPD System

classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
classification.special_class: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1% by weight
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, and electricity generation for A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), waste and wastewater treatment
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, construction waste, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected during deconstruction; transport distances assumed due to lack of primary data

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, reducing net CO2 emissions
carbonation.recommendation: Use standard for whole-of-life building studies; not reflected in EPD results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

NSW_ACT.composition: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.composition: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.composition: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.composition: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.composition: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, Volume 180, 2017
disclaimers: Results of some environmental impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
Use of modules A1-A3 or A4-A5 results without module C results may mislead decision-making
